commitResults.messageTitle: Renamed chatbot, greets user and exits.
commitResults.messageBody:
Removed all traces of old name and replaced with "Milo".
Initial skeletal version implemented via System.out.println.

Milo now echoes commands entered by the user, and
exits when the user says "bye".

Chatbot now stores input given by user
and displays it back to the user
when "list" is entered.

Integrate Task class and allow users
to mark and unmark tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tasks can now only be added using Todo, Deadline, Event
commitResults.messageBody:
Also implement date and time for Deadline
and Event.

Test typical user commands to reduce
need for manual testing.

Throw error when command format
is incorrect.

Add support for deleting
tasks from the list.

Incorporate TaskType and Status enums
and organised files in src code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Save and load tasks to disk on exit
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks in the chatbot are not persistent across sessions. Users
have to re-enter tasks everytime the chatbot starts.

Let's update Milo to read tasks from the hard disk when it starts
and write all changes back to the file when the user types "bye"
or exits.

This ensures that the task list is preserved between sessions,
but note that changes are only saved at the end of the session,
not whenever the task list is updated.

commitResults.messageTitle: Save tasks to disk immediately after changes
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks were only saved to the hard disk when the user exited
the chatbot with "bye". Any changes during the session were
lost if the program unexpectedly terminates.

Let's update Milo to save task list immediately after
any changes are made, ensuring data loss is minimised
and keeping tasks up-to-date in real time.
